Description: Up for sale is this vintage Ibanez XV500 electric guitar in a very cool pink/purple finish. The guitar was made in 1985 at the very reputable Tereda plant in Japan. Overall, the guitar is in good condition and is ready to be played!The guitar has been well kept and enjoyed over the years. There are some small scratches and dings throughout the guitar and a chip on the end of the lower cutaway and another small chip on the very top of the guitar. In addition, the neck pickup is cracked, but is still being held in place with the supporting screws. The guitar is missing the backplate cover, but replacements are available online. These are just cosmetic imperfections that do not affect the performance or integrity of the instrument. The frets have some wear, but have plenty of life in them. The action is setup low and the guitar plays very well. It is equipped with locking hardware that helps keep the guitar in tune even with heavy whammy bar use. The guitar has had the bridge pickup upgraded to a Jackson humbucker that compliments the neck pickup very well. Unfortunately, this particular model has been discontinued long ago and are becoming harder to find. The guitar comes with the original fitted hardshell case, which is also in very good condition. In addition, a non-original whammy bar arm is also included that seems to work fine. Please feel free to ask any questions or make an offer!
Title: Vintage 1985 Ibanez XV500 Purple/Pink Electric Guitar Locking Hardware MIJ Japan
